responses: Depending on your state  s laws and your personal circumstances
alimony (also called spousal support) may be awarded during a divorce. It can be temporary or permanent
though permanent support is less common today.
Hello!
How can I help You
Establishing paternity creates a legal relationship between a father and child. This can be done through voluntary acknowledgement
genetic testing
or other legal means. It may entitle the child to financial support and the father to visitation rights.
Collaborative divorce is an option for couples who want a cooperative
less contentious divorce process. It allows them to work together on agreements regarding finances
child custody
and other important matters without going to court.
After a divorce or separation
co  parents may create parenting agreements. These define where the children will live
visitation schedules
and who makes decisions about things like education and healthcare.
Victims of abuse
stalking
or harassment by family members can seek temporary or permanent restraining orders. These are court orders that reduce or eliminate contact between the abuser and the victim.
When deciding who keeps the marital home during a divorce
courts may consider factors such as who will have physical custody of the children and whether the home equity was acquired using separate or community funds.
If your ex  spouse refuses to pay child support
document each instance of non  payment. If the issue can  t be resolved privately
you can seek enforcement or file a contempt action through the court.
Family members such as stepparents
grandparents
aunts
and uncles are often given preference in adoption cases. Courts typically consider it in the child  s best interest to be placed with a relative when possible.
If your financial or personal circumstances have significantly changed
you may request a temporary or permanent modification of the alimony amount you are paying or receiving as part of your divorce settlement.
In most states
if your ex wants to move to another state with your children
they must either give you a chance to contest the move or seek court approval through a formal petition process.

SEAT BELT
Occupants in car must wear seat belts while vehicle is in motion (U  S 194  B of MV Act).
Not only using mobile phones
even using hands free devices to access mobile phones (earphones
Bluetooth headset
etc.
) while driving is an offence. You are allowed to use mobile phone when driving    riding for navigation purpose only...

With the exception of the driver other occupants of the motor vehicle can use a mobile phone. However the passenger should not facilitate the use of mobile phone by the driver by holding the mobile phone to the driver’s ear.
